N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 § 912.2 - Annual reports

State Regulations
(a) Each
railroad (see §
912.3
) or street railroad
corporation operating upon continuous elevated structures of more than one-half
mile in length is required within 30 days after the expiration of each calendar
year to file with the commissioner a report duly verified by the chief engineer
or other competent or responsible official or employee of such company under
whose direction the inspection is made to the effect that such company's
elevated structures were duly inspected by competent engineers during the
preceding calendar year and found safe, or if the structures were found unsafe
or in need of repair in any respect, reports shall so state and shall state the
particular in which they were found unsafe or in need of repair and what steps
have been taken or are being taken to make them safe or to repair
them. (b) As to all elevated
structures or bridges less than one-half mile in length each railroad (see
§
912.3
) or street railroad
corporation is required within 30 days after the completion of one such
inspection each year of said structure or bridge to make and file with the
commissioner a report such as is above described. Notes
